parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant

parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.

parameters.name: skip_default

client_nonfile_upload_max_body_size.description: Maximum size for the client request body for non-file uploads. Allowed values are 1-32768. Field deprecated in 18.1.5. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

regex_match_limit.description: Limit CPU utilization for each regular expression match when processing rules. Field introduced in 17.2.5.

max_execution_time.description: The maximum period of time WAF processing is allowed to take for a single request. A value of 0 (zero) means no limit and should not be chosen in production deployments. It is only used for exceptional situations where crashes of se_dp processes are acceptable. The behavior of the system if this time is exceeded depends on two other configuration settings, the WAF policy mode and the WAF failure mode. In WAF policy mode 'Detection', the request is allowed and flagged for both failure mode 'Closed' and 'Open'. In enforcement node, 'Closed' means the request is rejected, 'Open' means the request is allowed and flagged. Irrespective of these settings, no subsequent WAF rules of this or other phases will be executed once the maximum execution time has been exceeded. Allowed values are 0-5000. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

response_hdr_default_action.description: WAF default action for Response Header Phase. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

restricted_headers.description: WAF Restricted HTTP Headers. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

response_body_default_action.description: WAF default action for Response Body Phase. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

request_hdr_default_action.description: WAF default action for Request Header Phase. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

buffer_response_body_for_inspection.description: Enable to buffer response body for inspection. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

client_request_max_body_size.description: Maximum size for the client request body scanned by WAF. Allowed values are 1-32768. Field introduced in 18.1.5, 18.2.1.

client_file_upload_max_body_size.description: Maximum size for the client request body for file uploads. Allowed values are 1-32768. Field deprecated in 18.1.5. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

cookie_format_version.description: 0  For Netscape Cookies. 1  For version 1 cookies. Allowed values are 0-1. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

server_response_max_body_size.description: Maximum size for response body scanned by WAF. Allowed values are 1-32768. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

ignore_incomplete_request_body_error.description: Ignore request body parsing errors due to partial scanning. Field introduced in 18.1.5, 18.2.1.

allowed_request_content_types.description: WAF allowed Content Types. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

allowed_methods.description: WAF allowed HTTP methods. Enum options - HTTP_METHOD_GET, HTTP_METHOD_HEAD, HTTP_METHOD_PUT, HTTP_METHOD_DELETE, HTTP_METHOD_POST, HTTP_METHOD_OPTIONS, HTTP_METHOD_TRACE, HTTP_METHOD_CONNECT. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

allowed_http_versions.description: WAF allowed HTTP Versions. Enum options - ZERO_NINE, ONE_ZERO, ONE_ONE. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

request_body_default_action.description: WAF default action for Request Body Phase. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

static_extensions.description: WAF Static File Extensions. GET and HEAD requests with no query args and one of these extensions are whitelisted and not checked by the ruleset. Field introduced in 17.2.5.

restricted_extensions.description: WAF Restricted File Extensions. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

data.description: Stringified WAF File Data. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

name.description: WAF Data File Name. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

files.description: List of Data Files Used for WAF Rules. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

config.description: Config params for WAF. Field introduced in 17.2.1.
